programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Napa, CA: Marooned in San Francisco, Tony tastes local shellfish and durian ice cream before embarking on a pilgrimage to experience the genius of Thomas Keller, chef and owner of The French Laundry.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Join Tony on his quest to characterize the perfect bar in New York City. Discover the importance of a maniacal bartender, the proper chemical makeup of drinks, the joys of seedy dive-bars, and the need for late-night snacks.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Morocco (Sahara): Tony traverses the Moroccan desert with one goal in mind, to eat a mud-oven-roasted sheep.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: Eating on the Edge of Nowhere
programme.desc: Cambodia and Japan: Taking his obsession with the film Apocalypse Now a little too seriously, Tony sets out for Pailin, reputed to be one of the most dangerous towns on earth. After his journey, Tony returns to Japan.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: What is a Carioca? The natives of Rio de Janiero, Brazil are lovable scamps who find ways to avoid work, preferring the beach, flirting, and hanging out at restaurants and bars instead. Tony, under the tutelage of an exemplary Carioca, gives the lifestyle a try.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: Los Angeles, My Own Heart of Darkness
programme.desc: Los Angeles, CA: New York chef, Anthony Bourdain, descends into the culinary underbelly of his metropolitan nemesis, Los Angeles, where he experiences the trials of celebrity fame and the joys of West Coast cuisine.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Ever on a quest to learn more about food, Rick even vacations with a food-oriented agenda. Join him in the mountains of Finca Las Nieves, with its artisanal coffee production and organic gardens, and learn about sustainable gardening.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Essential features of the Mayan civilization are infused in the food, art, and architecture of modern Yucatan. Los Dos, a cooking school in Merida run by David Sterling, specializes in classic Mayan food updated for this century.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: "You are what you eat." Brillat Savarin's statement fuels Rick's tour of the 21 de Noviembre market in downtown Oaxaca. We uncover the incredibly rich culture of the market and its role in the daily lives and meals of the local population.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.sub-title: Rick and Jacques: Two Chefs at Playa
programme.desc: In Playa del Carmen, Rick meets with Chef Jacques Pepin. First, they enjoy breakfast at Jacques' favorite local spot before heading to the beach in search of fresh fish. After a stop at Jacques favorite local market, the cooking begins.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Oaxaca has long been known for its seven moles, unparalleled home-cooking, and remarkable market fare. Lately, its restaurant reputation has skyrocketed, too. Deservedly so. Rick visits four of the top chef contenders in Oaxaca City.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Chef and Author David Sterling takes Rick on an inspiring whirlwind tour of the Yucatan peninsula, including to the rustic wood-burning ovens at Panaderia Liz in Merida. Then, it is back to the gorgeous kitchen at Los Dos Cooking School.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.sub-title: Saintes Maries de la Mer: Traveler Pride
programme.desc: On May 24 each year, travelers from Europe flock to Saintes-Maries-de-la-Mer in France for a festive ritual in honor of Patron Saint Sara with whom travelers greatly identify. For one week, between 8,000 and 10,000 travelers travel to Camargue, filling the streets, squares, and seafront with energy.

programme.title: Welcome to My Strange City
programme.desc: Only 650 miles from the North Pole, there are three seasons in Longyearbyen: Polar summer, Northern Lights winter, and Sunny winter, and the elemental side of nature is a common factor in all decisions. The crystalline, light-lit hues of the land can remind one that true spirit shines from within.

programme.title: National Parks Revealed
programme.desc: Bask in luxurious getaways and rustic retreats that are almost as celebrated as the wondrous landscapes that surround them. The Old Faithful Inn in Yellowstone National Park, and the natural springs at the Furnace Creek Inn in Death Valley National Park are just two of the treasures you will visit.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.desc: If you like your nature a little weird, then this is the show for you. See all the freaks of nature in the best parks ever.

programme.title: Canada's National Parks
programme.desc: Explore a region famed for its hot springs, backcountry treks, and fantastic array of wildlife, and be treated to elegant dining, and chateaux retreats. Also, enjoy train rides aboard the Rocky Mountaineer, scenic drives along the Continental Divide, and Snocoach rides across treacherous ice fields.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: From the serene beauty of one man's architectural love poem to a woman, the Taj Mahal, to the crowded alleys of downtown New Delhi, India is a feast for the senses. Maxa discovers temples straight out of Disneyland and consults a street astrologer who tells him he will live a long life.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: Venture to Estonia and the islands of Saaremaa and Muhu where you will find windmills, thatch-roofed farmhouses, and quiet waters. Rudy interviews Mart Laar who took over Estonia under tough conditions following the withdrawal of Soviet troops and turned it into a dynamic country.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: Experience Polynesia's rich sea life, crystal blue waters, and vibrant cultures. Tour the diverse reefs of the coral, sea turtle rehabilitation centers, and the many islands and atolls. Participate in the oyster-cultivation process at the major pearl farm, and tour dramatic Marquesas Islands.

programme.title: Rick Steves' the Holy Land: Israelis and Palestinians Today
programme.desc: This hour-long special weaves together the Israeli and Palestinian narratives while visiting the big sights, delving deeper to better understand both perspectives.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Starting in the Finnish capital of Helsinki, we explore its Neoclassical old town, modern flair for design, and steamy saunas. Then it's a quick boat ride to Estonia's capital, Tallinn - with its medieval charms and post-USSR renaissance.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Rick Steves: We explore Rome on a more intimate scale — dodging Vespas in Trastevere, roaming through the historic Jewish Ghetto, and enjoying art treasures in a string of rarely visited churches to uncover the charms of hidden Rome.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: We'll experience the Amalfi Coast, resort of Positano and charms of Sorrento.

programme.title: WaterVoyagers - Chinese Adventures
programme.desc: Join the team as they visit ancient temples and awe-inspiring caverns.

programme.title: Discovering the World
programme.sub-title: Egypt of the Pharaohs - The Museum of Cairo and Upper Egypt
programme.desc: Take an exceptional journey to the heart of Ancient Egypt. Go inside the Cairo Museum and experience its inestimable treasures. Become privileged guests at one the world's three most widely visited landmarks thanks to remarkable aerial cinematography, and absorb a journey of incredible wealth.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.desc: On 1 November each year, in the cemeteries of the Sacatepequez region of Guatemala, Guatemalans communicate with the deceased in a unique and poetic way, using kites. Guatemalans believe with all their heart that the kites spiritually link them to communicate with their beloved ancestors.

programme.title: Secrets of the National Parks
programme.desc: Discover the secrets of the Southwest along famous Route 66 and the Grand Circle, an area concentrated with national parks. Discover how Monument Valley in Utah and Gallup in New Mexico became cinematic locations, jet-ski in Lake Powell, and explore the spirit of the Navajo in Canyon de Chelly.

programme.title: Inside America's National Parks
programme.desc: Grand Teton National Park is a geological wonder, a hiker's paradise, and an irresistible lure for thrill seekers and wildlife enthusiasts. Climb a sheer cliff wall, raft a raging river, visit an avalanche lab, join a search and rescue team, work a dude ranch, and rough it at posh retreats.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: Best Parks for Jaw Dropping Scenery
programme.desc: See Mother Nature at its best. From the highest waterfall to the one of the biggest holes in the world, it's this kind of scenery that will make you stop in your tracks.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: New York's Cuban-American community is alive with rhythm and dance. Mickela meets with the Afro-Latin Jazz Band, dances with the legendary Oyu Oro Afro-Cuban Dance Ensemble, and simmers in the sand with Cuban salsa on Rockaway Beach.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: Nashville, Tennessee is America's "Music City." Join Mickela as she revels in traditional American music and dance in this vibrant southern city, from line dancing and modern ballet to old-time buck dancing. Do you have the music in you?

programme.title: Moments in Time with Elia Locardi
programme.desc: Ari Amphibia take Elia to Jakarta's two best vantage points to capture the cityscape. After a successful photoshoot, Elia joins Gathot Subroto on a trip to a wet market, then heads to Dutchtown for a bike ride.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.desc: Emerald green Greek extra virgin olive oil is the star of this show as we watch it flow from tree to kitchen in the stunningly preserved town of Monemvasia. Explore the diversity and beauty of one of Greece's most delectable exports.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.desc: Greek food is by nature the ultimate comfort food thanks to the wealth of rustic home cooking that defines the cuisine. Diane explores some of these specialties stretching from the Ionian island of Zakynthos to the Aegean island of Tinos.

programme.title: Primal Grill with Steven Raichlen
programme.desc: Here’s the lowdown on spit-roasting duck, prime rib, and baby back ribs.

programme.title: Primal Grill with Steven Raichlen
programme.desc: In barbecue, bigger is better. These showstopper will impress your guests.

programme.title: Primal Grill with Steven Raichlen
programme.desc: Steven will teach you the right way to grill America’s favorite bird.

programme.title: Primal Grill with Steven Raichlen
programme.desc: Steven will show you how to grill the perfect pork shoulder.

programme.title: Primal Grill with Steven Raichlen
programme.desc: Every grill master needs at least one foolproof rib recipe. Here are three.

programme.title: Primal Grill with Steven Raichlen
programme.desc: Steven will teach you 3 foolproof ways to grill fish without fear or tears.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Ancient Greece laid the foundations of Western art. Traveling from its sun-splashed isles to the rugged mainland to bustling Athens, we trace the rise of Greek culture. We marvel at the timeless Acropolis, perfect Parthenon, and Golden Age theaters.
